revised_title: Optimal Hydrogen Ion Concentration and Temperature of the Style Enzyme in Pecten Maximus
tldr: The author investigates the optimal hydrogen ion concentration and temperature for the style enzyme in Pecten maximus, a scallop species. They found that the enzyme's activity is more rapid on the acidic side and that the optimal pH and temperature depend on the duration of the experiment. The study emphasizes the importance of considering the actual conditions found in living animals when investigating enzyme activity and digestion processes.
